cont.entity_a: Limited by its lower megapixel count for larger prints.
cont.entity_b: Excellent image quality, dynamic range, and color.

Compatibility.comm: Compatible with a wide range of lenses.

cont.entity_a: Most F-mount Nikon lenses, offering numerous options.
Only supports 2GB or smaller SD cards, requiring specific memory card purchases. Does not read current memory card types.
Manual is extensive, but the Nikon D50 Digital Field Guide by David D. Busch is helpful.
No Black and White mode or illuminated display on top.
Great value for the price, especially for beginners.
cont.entity_b: Price has dropped significantly, making it a great investment.

Accessories.comm: Requires additional accessories for optimal use.

cont.entity_a: Like telephoto lens, filters, case, battery, flash, and card reader.
Customer service issues related to grey market product status.
Camera does not include SD card or camera strap.
cont.entity_b: Missing focusing ring was not noted in the product description.

cont.entity_a: Autofocus is not perfect, but satisfactory for the price.
cont.entity_b: Older model lacks modern features like auto ISO and fast autofocus.
For those familiar with the Canon system.

cont.entity_a: Some units have issues with underexposed pictures and external flash functionality.
cont.entity_b: Some units have issues with sensor or shutter, requiring repair.

cont.entity_a: Received in perfect condition with all parts included.
cont.entity_b: Satisfactory performance even with signs of wear and tear.

Ease of Use.comm: Easy to handle and takes wonderful shots.

cont.entity_b: The camera's full-frame sensor enhances wide-angle lens performance.
Not ideal for beginners due to complexity.
